newsitem.title: FRANCE: Germany not buying Apache cruise missile - paper.
newsitem.headline: Germany not buying Apache cruise missile - paper.

text.p: Germany will not buy the Apache air-launched cruise missile for its Tornado combat jets, the French newspaper Les Echos reported on Tuesday.
Groupe Lagardere's Matra Defense Espace subsidiary is prime contractor on the Apache missile, with state-owned SNI Aerospatiale as a subcontractor.
The newspaper reported that the head of the German BWB arms procurement office had written to his French counterpart saying the German air force will not buy the anti-runway version of the Apache.

Germany has spent some 650 francs adapting the Tornado to carry the Apache in a contract with Matra which is in its final stage, the report said. Bonn cited technical and financial problems, as well as delays on the missile project, it said.
No-one was immediately available for comment at Lagardere. The French DGA arms procurement office declined to comment.
